hints.content:
###Background 

The complex conjugate of a complex number $z=\maroonD{a}+\tealD{b}i$ is given by $\bar{z}=\maroonD{a}-\tealD{b}i$. 

This is equal to the original complex number, but with the sign of the imaginary part reversed. On the complex plane, it is the reflection of the original point across the real axis. [[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
The graph below shows a complex number and its conjugate, which is its reflection across the real axis. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/ec05bc822a3d8fb875bd39e95b8c9b98d6887e5a)

hints.content:
###Finding the complex conjugate

We see that $z_1=\tealD{6}i\maroonD{-7}$ is of the form $z=\maroonD{a}+\tealD{b}i$, where $\maroonD{a}=\maroonD{-7}$ and  $\tealD{b}=\tealD{6}$. 

Therefore, by reversing the sign of its imaginary part, the complex conjugate of $z_1$ is given by $\bar{z_1}=-\tealD{6}i\maroonD{-7}$. This is shown in the graph below. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/01816afbd345449b58182671d76a0868e769166b)

###Summary 

$\bar{z_1}=-6i-7$

###Background 

The complex conjugate of a complex number $z=\maroonD{a}+\tealD{b}i$ is given by $\bar{z}=\maroonD{a}-\tealD{b}i$. 

This is equal to the original complex number, but with the sign of the imaginary part reversed. On the complex plane, it is the reflection of the original point across the real axis. [[☃ explanation 1]]

We see that $z_1=\tealD{5}i+\maroonD{5}$ is of the form $z=\maroonD{a}+\tealD{b}i$, where $\maroonD{a}=\maroonD{5}$ and  $\tealD{b}=\tealD{5}$. 

Therefore, by reversing the sign of its imaginary part, the complex conjugate of $z_1$ is given by $\bar{z_1}=\tealD{-5}i+\maroonD{5}$. This is shown in the graph below.

###Summary

This is equal to the original complex number, but with the sign of the imaginary part reversed. On the complex plane, it is the reflection of the original point across the real axis. [[☃ explanation 1]]

hints.content:
###Plotting the Complex Conjugate

The complex conjugate of $z_1$ is just the reflection of $z_1$ across the real axis. This is plotted below. 

[[☃ explanation 1]]

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/10ea9b781bdbbb6c3ffb29e60655785470dda416)

options.explanation:
Here, $z_1=\maroonD{6}+\tealD{4}i$, which is of the form $z=\maroonD{a}+\tealD{b}i$, where $\maroonD{a}=\maroonD{6}$ and $\tealD{b}=\tealD{4}$. Therefore: 

$\begin{align}\bar{z}&=\maroonD{a}-\tealD{b}i
\\\\&=\maroonD{6}-\tealD{4}i\end{align}$

This agrees with our graph.

hints.content:
###Summary


![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/0317aae9be1ef5b15aeef88483f65b19c244d940)

question.content:
**A complex number $z_1$ is plotted below. Plot its complex conjugate, $\bar{z_1}$.** 

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

hints.content:
###Background 

The complex conjugate of a complex number $z=\maroonD{a}+\tealD{b}i$ is given by $\bar{z}=\maroonD{a}-\tealD{b}i$. 

This is equal to the original complex number, but with the sign of the imaginary part reversed. On the complex plane, it is the reflection of the original point across the real axis. [[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
The graph below shows a complex number and its conjugate, which is its reflection across the real axis. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/ec05bc822a3d8fb875bd39e95b8c9b98d6887e5a)

hints.content:
###Plotting the Complex Conjugate

The complex conjugate of $z_1$ is just the reflection of $z_1$ across the real axis. This is plotted below. 

[[☃ explanation 1]]

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/71cc8c2cf6351d88c7bf365618596af141ebf369)

options.explanation:
Here, $z_1=\maroonD{7}+\tealD{3}i$, which is of the form $z=\maroonD{a}+\tealD{b}i$, where $\maroonD{a}=\maroonD{7}$ and $\tealD{b}=\tealD{3}$. Therefore: 

$\begin{align}\bar{z}&=\maroonD{a}-\tealD{b}i
\\\\&=\maroonD{7}-\tealD{3}i\end{align}$

This agrees with our graph.

hints.content:
###Summary


![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/da13c9364749904f6cf9b9798e28311362faf7de)
